Issues.Title: Remove CAS related suppressions
Issues.Body:
CA2122 was an FxCop violation related to code access security. Removing them as CAS isn't supported in .NET Core. (And all of the CAS attributes have been removed.)

Also remove a no-op debug track of the AppDomain for window handles. Multiple AppDomains aren't supported in .NET Core.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Remove CAS related suppressions" (#1242)

Issues.Title: Review EM_* message correctness
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->



## Proposed changes

- As part the #791 refactor `EM_*` messages got mixed with `RTB.EM_*` messages that led to an issue described in #994.

  * Restore correct EM_ messagest
  * Separate RTB.EM_ messages
  * Update RichTextBox to use RTB.EM_* messages

Fixes #994
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Review EM_* message correctness" (#1234)

Issues.Title: Add Warning in WindowsDesktop SDK for UseWinForms
Issues.Body:
See https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1027#issuecomment-505092719 

The comment from @drewnoakes suggests that there is occasional confusion that leads to the use of `UseWinForms` in `Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop` based projects instead of using the correct property `UseWindowsForms`. 

The current behavior will be warning `NETSDK1106` ("Windows Desktop SDK requires UseWpf or UseWindowsForms"). This should help the vast majority of WinForms projects that guess the property name wrong. 

The small number of projects that try to set `UseWpf` and `UseWinForms` (instead of the correct property `UseWindowsForms`) will not receive any warnings today. 

We should evaluate whether a new warning is needed to help those who set `UseWinForms` and add it to the WindowsDesktop SDK. 

/cc @merriemcgaw, @OliaG
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add Warning in WindowsDesktop SDK for UseWinForms " (#1226)

Issues.Title: Add intellisense blob as part of native toolset restore
Issues.Body:
@AdamYoblick Here is a basic outline that on-boards the intellisense blob to your build process. You can build on top of this and add relevant targets to integrate the right xmls into your transport package. 

Feel free to close the PR and cherry-pick the relevant commit directly, or use the change shown here however you want.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add intellisense blob as part of native toolset restore" (#1241)

Issues.Title: Fix UserControl.DesignMode property
Issues.Body:
In Framework, there is an issue with UserControl.DesignMode property(more details [here]( https://stackoverflow.com/questions/34664/designmode-with-nested-controls) and I Quote:

> if you nest controls then DesignMode only works for the first level. The second and lower levels DesignMode will always return FALSE. The standard hack has been to look at the name of the process that is running and if it is "DevEnv.EXE" then it must be studio thus DesignMode is really TRUE. The problem with that is looking for the ProcessName works its way around through the registry and other strange parts with the end result that the user might not have the required rights to see the process name. In addition this strange route is very slow. So we have had to pile additional hacks to use a singleton and if an error is thrown when asking for the process name then assume that DesignMode is FALSE. A nice clean way to determine DesignMode is in order. Acually getting Microsoft to fix it internally to the framework would be even better!

I faced this problem just today, so, I hope you fix this in the CorFx version.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Fix UserControl.DesignMode property" (#1238)

Issues.Title: Accessibility:[Keyboard] The narrator can’t focus on correct item of CheckedBoxList control
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100 Preview7 12618 from master branch
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes. the bug [918826](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/918826) still can reproduce in framework.

**Repro Steps:**
1.	Open the attached application, build and run.[ReproApplication.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/3329450/ReproApplication.zip)
2.	Open the narrator, and noticed that the scan mode is **scan on**.
3.	Using the down arrow to iterate the items of checkedlistbox control.

**More info:**
1.	The issue can’t repro on when setting the scan mode is **scan off**.
2.	The issue can’t reproduce on the listbox control.

**Actual:**
The dot line still stay on the first item, and the narrator can’t focus on correct item of CheckedBoxList control
![Issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/38325459/60170996-3a97d700-983c-11e9-831c-2d6ecb81f4cf.PNG)

**Expected:**
The narrator should focus on correct item of CheckedBoxList control
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility:[Keyboard] The narrator can’t focus on correct item of CheckedBoxList control" (#1235)

Issues.Title: Add missing resources for System.Design namespace
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Original work done by @dreddy-work 
Obsoletes #941


## Proposed changes

- Port the resources required for the source code that are already ported.
- Bitmap icons/images are replaced with `Icon`s
- Port all the images, equivalent, to desktop framework. Even though,  we did not port all the source code that require/use these images. Replacing existing Bitmaps with Icons have a cross team dependency. hence, pushing all of them in one go hoping that we fill the gap in porting the source code between core and desktop framework.



<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add missing resources for System.Design namespace" (#1229)
